videoSnippet.title: Tal Resigns, and then his Wife WINS the Game!
videoSnippet.description:
#agadmator Lublin's Tournament, 1974. Since 1966, the year in which Jan Adamski faced simultaneous Tal, eight years have passed. Meanwhile, Adamski got some good results and, above all, a third place in the Havana military championship in 1967, after Hort and Vasiukov and before players such as Pribyl, Savon and Jansa.
Tal, still with the White, opens this time with 1st and 4th, Adamski answers with Sicilian.

Mikhail Tal vs Jan Adamski
Lublin (1974), Lublin POL 
Sicilian Defense: Scheveningen Variation. Keres Attack (B81)

1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 e6 3. d4 cd4 4. Nd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6 6. g4 h6 7. g5 hg5 8. Bg5 Nc6 9. Qd2 Qb6 10. Nb3 a6 11. O-O-O Bd7 12. Bg2 Ne5 13. Qe2 Rc8 14. f4 Nc4 15. Rd3 Qc7 16. h4 Be7 17. Re1 b5 18. e5 de5 19. fe5 Nh5 20. Qf2 Ne5 21. Rh3 f6 22. Be3 b4 23. Bb6 Ng4 24. Nd5 Nf2 25. Nc7 Rc7 26. Rf3 Rc8 27. Rf2 e5 28. Be3 Ng3 29. Bb7 Rc7 30. Ba6 Nf5 31. Bd2 Rh4 32. Bd3 g6 33. Be3 Kf7 34. Bb6 Rb7 35. Nc5 Rb6 36. Nd7 Rd6 37. Nc5 Rc6 38. Nd7 Rc7 39. Nb6 Bc5 40. Bc4
